article_title: Bureaucracy, Not Drugs, Drives Health Costs
article_text:
Regarding Michael Mandel’s “The Folly of Targeting Big Pharma” (op-ed, Dec. 11): Without doubt, the biggest single driver of health-care spending and major recipient of “health-care” dollars is the maintenance and expansion of federal “Barrc”: bureaucracy, administration, rules, regulation and compliance.

Washington nicely avoids accounting for the cost of Barrc because it knows that it is the big spender. Instead, it hides behind claims like, “Medicare administrative cost is only 3%,” leaving consumers to infer that 97%...
